thread.title: Will Orleans Darkwa be a fixture in Giants' running back committee going forward?
thread.title_full: Will Orleans Darkwa be a fixture in Giants' running back committee going forward? | NJ.com

author: James Kratch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Will Orleans Darkwa be a fixture in Giants' running back committee going forward?
text:
EAST RUTHERFORD â€” Orleans Darkwa got his opportunity on Sunday, and he ran with it.
Darkwa entered the game as the Giants ' main running back on the third offensive series of the game against the Dallas Cowboys and took over, rushing for 41 yards on four carries during the series, capped by a 15-yard touchdown run, where he broke through Cowboys defenders and reached the ball over the goal line and broke the plane, to give the Giants an early lead.
The second-year back would finish the game with a team-leading eight carries as the Giants collectively put together their best rushing effort of the season in their 27-20 win , averaging 5.3 yards per carry and finally rushing for over 100 yards for the first time this season.
Did Darkwa do enough to become a permanent fixture in the Giants' running back stable alongside Rashad Jennings, Shane Vereen and Andre Williams?
"I hope so," Darkwa said when asked if he felt he earned more carries, and he certainly made his case. Offensive coordinator Ben McAdoo had hinted Darkwa, who led the Giants in rushing in the preseason, could see some work . But until the coaching staff informed him he was going in moments before he did, Darkwa said he was, er, in the dark about getting carries.
PLUS : Tom Coughlin says Damontre Moore's benching is between them
"They told me the drive before. I wasn't really expecting it, but I try to stay ready," Darkwa said. "I always look at the film, and I'm always asking Rashad and Andre and Shane questions, just in case."
Giants coach Tom Coughlin said the plan was for Darkwa to get carries all along.
"He certainly did look good out there," Coughlin said. "His touchdown run, when he cut back behind the slanting defensive line, was really quite an outstanding play. ... We planned on having an opportunity with him, and he did come through for us."
Now the question is whether or not Darkwa gets more chances to come through for the Giants. Sunday's win saw the Giants strike almost a 50-50 run-pass balance . Quarterback Eli Manning threw 24 passes, and the four running backs combined for 21 rushes.
Darkwa had the most with eight, but Vereen led the team with 56 yards on his four carries, breaking a 39-yard run. The team finished with 132 yards on 25 carries, counting four kneel-downs by Manning. Jennings had five carries for 19 yards while Williams had four for 13.
